info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 4:15PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 414 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Edinburg to Fonda to near Brookfield and moving east at 55 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Gloversville, Fonda, Edinburg, Fort Johnson and Tribes Hill around 420 PM EST. Amsterdam and Hagaman around 425 PM EST. Milton and Rock City Falls around 430 PM EST. Saratoga Springs, Glenville, Duanesburg, Rotterdam Junction and Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction around 435 PM EST. Rotterdam, Scotia and East Glenville around 440 PM EST. Schenectady, Niskayuna, Alplaus, Burnt Hills and Country Knolls around 445 PM EST. Clifton Park, Colonie and Greenwich around 450 PM EST. Cohoes, Watervliet, Mechanicville, Latham, Waterford, Sharon Springs and Loudonville around 455 PM EST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 25. Interstate 90 near exit 1W, between exits 1N and 1E, and between exits 25 and 29. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 24 and 7, and between exits 8A and 16. Interstate 787 between exits 8 and 9. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
